com.clearblade.platform.api

Class ClearBlade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clearblade.platform.api.ClearBlade

  • public class ClearBlade
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that manage API configurations, initialization, and API information

    This class consists of static methods that:

    • Manage configurations for the ClearBlade API
    • Provide SDK and API information
    • Initialize the ClearBlade Library for use
    *You must call initialize(String systemKey, String systemSecret) or its other variants to initialize the API*

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clyde Byrd III, Aaron Allsbrook, Michael Sprague

        public static void setAllowUntrusted(boolean allowUntrustedCertificates)
        Allows for passing requests to an untrusted server. This method is not recommended for any scenario other than development

      • getAllowUntrusted

        public static boolean getAllowUntrusted()
        Allows for passing requests to an untrusted server.
        Returns:
        boolean value for using untrusted backend servers

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String systemKey,
                              java.lang.String systemSecret,
                              InitCallback callback)
        Initializes the API for the given system as an anonymous user. (If the system has user authentication required set to true, this will fail - See the initialize method mentioned below) Must be called prior to any API calls Throws IllegalArgumentException if myAppKey or myAppSecret is null
        Parameters:
        myAppKey - The key used to identify the Application in use
        myAppSecret - The secret used to verify the Application in use throws IllegalArgumentException

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String systemKey,
                              java.lang.String systemSecret,
                              java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> initOptions,
                              InitCallback callback)
        Initializes API with given system credentials and options. Upon Success/Failure, appropriate callback methods are triggered Must be called prior to any API calls. Available init options: email - String to register or log-in as specific user (required if password is given) Default - null
        password - password String for given user (required if email is given) Default - null
        platformURL - Custom URL for the platform Default - https://platform.clearblade.com
        messagingURL - Custom Messaging URL Default - tcp://messaging.clearblade.com:1883
        registerUser - Boolean to tell if you'd like to attempt registering the given user Default - false
        logging - Boolean to enable ClearBlade Internal API logging Default - false
        callTimeout - Int number of milliseconds for call timeouts Default - 30000 (30 seconds)
        allowUntrusted - Boolean to connect to a platform server without a signed SSL certificate Default - false Throws IllegalArgumentException if systemKey or systemSecret is null
        Parameters:
        systemKey - The key used to identify the System in use
        systemSecret - The secret used to verify the System in use
        initOptions - HashMap of initialization options
        callback - InitCallback for when initialization is done (success of failure)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • isLogging

        public static boolean isLogging()
        Returns a boolean that specifies if the API will show internal Logs
        Returns:
        logging boolean

      • setCallTimeOut

        public static void setCallTimeOut(int timeOut)
        Sets the time in milliseconds that an http Request will wait for a connection with the backend until it is aborted.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - milliseconds until http request is aborted

      • setLogging

        public static void setLogging(boolean value)
        If value is true, internal API logs will be displayed throughout the use of the API else no internal logs displayed
        Parameters:
        value - determines API logging

      • setMasterSecret

        public static void setMasterSecret(java.lang.String myMasterSecret)

        Sets the masterSecret of the Application. If masterSecret is set it will be used instead of the appSecret. It gives complete access to APP resources

        Never use the masterSecret in production code.
        Parameters:
        myMasterSecret - - The Applications Admin secret

        public static void setInitError(boolean value)
